## Introduction

In this notebook, I'll document all tasks and etivities related to R programming from module 12 intro

### Defining the parameter name and Function sayHello

First, define the `name` parameter in R. This parameter will be the name that should be returned.
```{r}
name <- "Jannis"
```
Then, define the `sayHello` function in R. This function will simply return the name "Jannis".
```{r}
sayHello <- function() {
  return(name)
}
```

### Calling the Function sayHello

Now that the function is defined, call it once to see the output.

```{r}
# Calling the sayHello function
sayHello()
```

The function returned the name "Jannis" as expected.
